title: Why is League so big?
body: I just went to my storage and saw league is taking 22GB of storage. Would like to know if there is a way so i can make it smaller maybe a way to get rid of the new client stick with legacy or will riot ever delete folders that aren't needed if there are any to make it as small as they can. most of my other games take hardly anything like CSGO or Rocket League and many more

replies.body:
the game is roughly 7GB. But every time you update, it downloads 400-800 MB and doesnt delete the unnecessary stuff. Its good to just do a clean install every 4-5 months if you worries about saving space.

Right now there is a lot more because the new client and other things, so i'd wait until they faze out the legacy client (sometime soon) and then do a clean install.

22 gig seems excessive, I'm sitting on 10 with almost 2g worth of logs.... check your log folder. feel free to delete it. It will re-write what it needs and you'll have all those previous games stored in there gone.
